body: Yes, seems to be a bug, in theory all components should be already using the configured user agent when creating default messages. Do you still have the session around? It would be great to know the type of that message.
It's easy enough to recreate. What do you mean by the type of message? What info do you need?

If we could reproduce it then we'd be able to get all the info we need :)
So do you have any steps we can follow?

Well, the steps are in the original message, but here they are again, expanded:

To reproduce, 

- tools->options->connection->default user agent
   set value to 'Firefox 39.0 Win8.1 64-bit'
- attack a url - to ensure it worked on a public URL I attacked google.com for about 30 seconds
- examining the headers will reveal that the user agent is usually Mozilla/5.0, but occasionally Mozilla/4.0
   In my scan this was, for example, **`Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set`** on the first entry: **`GET: https://www.google.com/`**

Expected behaviour is that all pages will be attacked with the same user agent that has been set in 'connection' as above.

How is the target being accessed? Spider? Proxy?

The type indicates which component (spider, manually, proxy...) created the request. The type is not exposed in the UI (you would have to use the ZAP API, one of the message/alert core endpoints).
I wasn't using the API, I used the quick attack form on the welcome page of the UI. No proxy. The attack progressed through spider and scan.

issue.title: quickstart: use default user agent for spider seed
issue.body:
Change AttackThread to create the HTTP message, for the spider, with the
connection configurations to use the default user agent.
Update changes in ZapAddOn.xml file.

Part of zaproxy/zaproxy#4846 - User-Agent changes from configured value

body: A new version of Quick Start add-on is available in the marketplace, it should address that.
Reopening, still pending core changes to prevent similar issues.

issue.title: Use default user agent in all default messages

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change ConnectionParam to set the default user agent into the
HttpRequestHeader to be used in the default request headers, instead of
requiring users to pass a ConnectionParam, the latter is error prone.
Change HttpRequestHeader to allow to set (and use) the default user
agent and deprecate the constructor that accepts a ConnectionParam.
Change codebase to no longer use the (now) deprecated constructor.

Fix #4846- User-Agent changes from configured value

issue.title: Ban Agent Tag for Attack Button (Cloudflare)

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
* click the attack button on 2.7.0 for any Cloudflare hosted site * instant 403 due to ban headers in 'attack' button 'Windows NT' * solution: suggest attack button try different agent tags first before bailing or use updated agent tag. Request: ``` GET / HTTP/1.1 User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.0;) Pragma: no-cache Cache-Control: no-cache Content-Length: 0 Host: www.rmccurdy.com Connection: close ``` Response: ``` HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden Date: Mon, 08 Apr 2019 20:07:46 GMT Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8 Connection: close Set-Cookie: __cfduid=d89754e798d08e4d2a20b64bac72a8cfe1554754066; expires=Tue, 07-Apr-20 20:07:46 GMT; path=/; domain=.rmccurdy.com; HttpOnly Cache-Control: max-age=10 Expires: Mon, 08 Apr 2019 20:07:56 GMT X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN Expect-CT: max-age=604800, report-uri="https://report-uri.cloudflare.com/cdn-cgi/beacon/expect-ct" Server: cloudflare CF-RAY: 4c46de936af2b3c0-IAH Content-Length: 3108 Access denied | www.rmccurdy.com used Cloudflare to restrict access
Please enable cookies.

Error 1010 Ray ID: 4c46de936af2b3c0 • 2019-04-08 20:07:46 UTC

Access denied

What happened?

The owner of this website (www.rmccurdy.com) has banned your access based on your browser's signature (4c46de936af2b3c0-ua91).

Cloudflare Ray ID: 4c46de936af2b3c0 • Your IP: 50.225.47.29 • Performance & security by Cloudflare

```

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
